citation.article-title: Phenotypic and phylogenetic characterization of some Eubacterium-like isolates containing a novel type B wall murein from human feces: description of Holdemania filiformis gen. nov., sp. nov.

p.s: Holdemania (Hold.eman'ia. Holdemania L. n., named to honor Lillian V. Holdeman Moore, a contemporary American microbiologist, for her outstanding contribution to anaerobic bacteriology)
Cells are rod shaped and occur in pairs and short chains.
Growth in broth media is enhanced by addition of Tween 80.
Main fermentation end products from glucose are acetic and lactic acids; succinic acid is produced in smaller amounts.
The cell walls contain a BlÎ´-type peptidoglycan with an (L-Ala)-D-Glu-L-Asp-L-Lys interpeptide bridge.
Long-chain fatty acids are of the nonhydroxylated, monounsaturated or saturated type.
The DNA base composition is 38 mol% G+C.
The type species is H. filiformis.
The genus Holdemania is a member of the Clostridium subphylum of the gram-positive bacteria and exhibits a close phylogenetic association with the genus Erysipelothrix.
